title: England star Jonny Bairstow reacts after his Hundred team sign Ashes rivals Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc
text:
Jonny Bairstow has reacted to the signings of Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc (Picture: Getty)

Jonny Bairstow has heaped praise on Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc after joining forces with the Australia stars for next summer’s The Hundred competition.

After Leeds-based Northern Superchargers opted to sign Ben Stokes as their England centrally contracted Test player, Yorkshire star Bairstow was assigned to Welsh Fire.

The Cardiff side, who will be coached by former England target Gary Kirsten, added Somerset sensation Tom Banton and Glamorgan hero Colin Ingram to their squad ahead of the draft.

At Sunday’s draft, Welsh Fire spent £250,000 on Smith – who averaged over 100 in last summer’s Ashes series – and Starc – who enjoyed a record-breaking World Cup.

England wicketkeeper-batsman Bairstow said: ‘You look at the names in that [Welsh Fire] line-up, there’s some serious firepower.

‘Obviously we’ve got Starc, who is a top bowler and will hopefully knock them over at the top.

Australia bowler Mitchell Starc will join Bairstow at Welsh Fire (Picture: Getty)

‘And we saw how well Smith played this summer, we know the quality of player he is. Coming back to a new competition in England, he’ll be keen to impress again.’

Welsh Fire also picked up Ben Duckett, Ravi Rampaul, Simon Harmer, Qais Ahmed, Liam Plunkett, Ryan ten Doeschate, David Payne, Ryan Higgins, Danny Briggs and Leus du Plooy at the draft.

Bairstow’s England team-mate Jos Buttler was at Sky studios during the event and threw his support behind the ECB’s new tournament.

Welsh Fire’s 15-man squad for The Hundred (Picture: Getty)

He said: ‘I actually came today thinking this is probably one of the most exciting days for English cricket, for us to have a franchise tournament starting next year.

‘Usually you’re watching this stuff on TV, putting your name in and hoping to be picked up, so to have this tournament on our doorstep is a massive moment for cricket in this country.

‘We’ve put together a team [Manchester Originals] that can be together for a long time as well – to have a side that’s really going to grow and build a brand for the franchise is really exciting.’
